meta.hint: Present tense verbs tell you about something that is happening now.example Most present-tense verbs are regular. They have no ending, or they end in -s or -es.example Two verbs are irregular in the present tense, to be and to have. You must remember their example forms.example Past tense verbs tell you about something that has already happened.example Most past-tense verbs are regular. They end in -ed.example Some verbs are irregular in the past tense. You must remember their past-tense forms.example Future tense verbs tell you about something that is going to happen.example All future-tense verbs use the word will.example Present                 Past        Futureexample walk, walks          walked    will walkexample go, goes               went         will goexample
meta.question: Which tense does the sentence use?
